column4: And if you can't find it, do sudo apt-cache search xchat and install what comes up.
wtf? I have no wireless entry anymore.
The interface is not listed.
YARLY.
yes.
else network-admin doesn't run.
I was working on this last night as well.
Last night there was a wireless entry, then I blacklisted the native Linux drivers for my nic because I installed them with ndiswrapper, and now there is no entry.
yes, I checked in the bios.
did you include ndiswrappers in the modules list?
I followed https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper
did you use lsmod | grep ndis   to make sure ndiswrapper is loaded?
not loaded.
told you so :-P ;)
generally the current directory isn't in the path, so you need ./ to run a program in it.
normally bash will search the current directory for an executable.
only if the current directory is in the $PATH variable, normally it isn't.
Can't you just add . to $PATH?
ofcourse .. but you shouldn't.
why not?
because it can cause confusion with you're developing software and it keeps you from accidentally executing files.
yes it will, and you can do that.  I'm not telling you not to add . to your path, just don't go around telling everyone to do it :)
